org.araneaframework.uilib.form.control
Class BaseSelectControl<T,C>

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.core.BaseComponent
      org.araneaframework.core.BaseService
          org.araneaframework.core.BaseWidget
              org.araneaframework.core.BaseApplicationWidget
                  org.araneaframework.uilib.form.control.BaseControl<T>
                      org.araneaframework.uilib.form.control.StringArrayRequestControl<C>
                          org.araneaframework.uilib.form.control.BaseSelectControl<T,C>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Component, Composite, Composite.CompositeComponent, Composite.CompositeService, Composite.CompositeWidget, ApplicationComponent, ApplicationService, ApplicationWidget, Service, Control<C>, FormElementAware<C,Object>, DisplayItemContainer<T>, Viewable, Viewable.ViewableComponent, Viewable.ViewableService, Viewable.ViewableWidget, Widget
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultiSelectControl, SelectControl
public abstract class BaseSelectControl<T,C>
extends StringArrayRequestControl<C>
implements DisplayItemContainer<T>

This class represents the base functionality of select controls. The generic T is the type of select control item. The generic C is the internal value type used with StringArrayRequestControl.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

BaseSelectControl

public BaseSelectControl(List<T> items,
                         Class<T> itemClass,
                         String itemLabelProperty,
                         String itemValueProperty,
                         String itemIsGroupProperty,
                         String groupChildrenProperty)
Creates a new instance of *SelectControl, and also defines item class and label and value property names. Note that usually the class parameter is not needed. It is needed only when the select values are defined one-by-one with addItem(String, String) method (then class is used to create new instances). The label and value property names are required.

Optional properties for making use of <optgroup>s are itemIsGroupProperty and groupChildrenProperty. The former property, when specified, is checked on every display item, and when the property is true, the display item is considered to represent an <optgroup> (its label property is used for fetching the name of the group; its value property will be ignored). For every <optgroup> item, the groupChildrenProperty will be checked to retrieve items of type T in an array or List to fetch the <option>s for the group.

NB! Specifying itemIsGroupProperty and groupChildrenProperty to a select control can only be done through this constructor!

Parameters:
items - Predefined select items. May be null.
itemClass - The class of the items stored in this select (needed when select values are defined one-by-one).
itemLabelProperty - The String property of select item to retrieve the label of select item (required).
itemValueProperty - The String property of select item to retrieve the value of select item (required).
itemIsGroupProperty - The Boolean property of select item to retrieve the condition value that this select item is a non-selectable <optgroup> containing other child <option>s (optional, but mandatory when groupChildrenProperty is provided).
groupChildrenProperty - The array/List<T> property of a group item to retrieve the child <option>s to render in the <optgroup> (optional, but mandatory when itemIsGroupProperty is provided).
See Also:
BaseSelectControl#BaseSelectControl(List, String, String, String, String), addItem(String, String)
Method Detail

addItem

public void addItem(T item)
Description copied from interface: DisplayItemContainer
Adds a display item to the element.

Specified by:
addItem in interface DisplayItemContainer<T>
Parameters:
item - A non-null item to be added.

addItem

public void addItem(T item,
                    String groupLabel)

addItem

public void addItem(String label,
                    String value)
A convenient method for cases when select items are defined one-by-one as key-value pairs. An instance of the class (that was given to the constructor) is created, and, using label and value properties, the given label and value are set. The created item will be placed in the default group (placebo for items that are not rendered as a group).

Parameters:
label - The label for the new item.
value - The value for the new item.
See Also:
addItem(Class, String, String)

addItem

public void addItem(String label,
                    String value,
                    String groupLabel)

addItem

public void addItem(Class<T> itemClass,
                    String label,
                    String value)
A convenient method for cases when select items are defined one-by-one. An instance of given class is created, and, using label and value properties, the given label and value are set. The created item will be placed in the default group (placebo for items that are not rendered as a group).

Parameters:
itemClass - The class that matches the items type of given select control.
label - The label for the new item.
value - The value for the new item.
See Also:
addItem(String, String)

addItem

public void addItem(Class<T> itemClass,
                    String label,
                    String value,
                    String groupLabel)
A convenient method for cases when select items are defined one-by-one. An instance of given class is created, and, using label and value properties, the given label and value are set. The created item will be placed in the group with given groupLabel (created, when it does not exist).

Parameters:
itemClass - The class that matches the items type of given select control.
label - The label for the new item.
value - The value for the new item.
See Also:
addItem(String, String)

disableItem

public void disableItem(T item)
Disables the given select item, which should be among the defined select items. If the given item is not found then it is ignored.

Parameters:
item - The select item to disable.

disableItems

public void disableItems(Collection<T> items)
Disables the given select items, which should be among the defined select items. If any of the given items is not found then it will be ignored.

Parameters:
items - The select items to disable.

public List<T> getEnabledItems()
Description copied from interface: DisplayItemContainer
Returns a list of display items that this DisplayItemContainer currently holds and that are enabled for selection. When this container does not distinguish enabled/disabled display items, this method will always return the same result as DisplayItemContainer.getAllItems().

sort

public void sort(Comparator<T> comparator)
Provides a way to sort the items in this select control. When more than one group is present, the comparator will sort items per group.

Parameters:
comparator - Used for defining the order of options per group, must not be null.
Since:
1.2

sortGroups

public void sortGroups(Comparator<SelectGroup<T>> comparator)
Provides a way to sort the groups in this select control.

Parameters:
comparator - Used for defining the order of groups, must not be null.
Since:
2.0

isCheckValuesUnique

public boolean isCheckValuesUnique()
Provides whether this SelectControl checks whether the values are unique when adding a new value to the current values. By default, values uniqueness check is turned on.

Returns:
A Boolean that is true when values uniqueness check is turned on.
Since:
2.0

setCheckValuesUnique

public void setCheckValuesUnique(boolean checkValuesUnique)
Sets whether this SelectControl must check whether the values are unique when adding a new value to the current values. By default, values uniqueness check is turned on.

Setting this property to true when this SelectControl already has values will result in a values uniqueness check.

Parameters:
checkValuesUnique - A Boolean that is true when values uniqueness check must be turned on.
Since:
2.0

getViewModel

public BaseSelectControl.ViewModel getViewModel()
Description copied from class: BaseApplicationWidget
Returns the view model of this control. The view model is used to retrieve data that MVC view layer can access. Note that returned view model and its type is entirely the sole responsibility of the control. However, the controls may change the return type to their implementation of view model.

Overrides:
getViewModel in class StringArrayRequestControl<C>
